column2: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11,7 % in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario so that the Union’s final energy consumption amounts to no more than 763 Mtoe (art. 4 Directive)
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Energy Consumption" because it aims to decrease the overall energy consumption in the EU.

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11,7 % in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario so that the Union’s final energy consumption amounts to no more than 763 Mtoe (art. 4 Directive)
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Efficiency" as reducing energy consumption is a key aspect of energy efficiency.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to re-establish the habitat types listed in Annex I in areas not covered by those habitat types with the aim to reach their favourable reference area. Such measures shall be in place on areas representing at least 30 % of the additional overall surface needed to reach the total favourable reference area of each group of habitat types listed in Annex I, as quantified in the national restoration plan referred to in Article 12, by 2030, at least 60 % of that surface by 2040, and 100 % of that surface by 2050
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Habitat Restoration" because it focuses on restoring habitat types listed in Annex I.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall put in place the restoration measures that are necessary to re-establish the habitat types listed in Annex I in areas not covered by those habitat types with the aim to reach their favourable reference area. Such measures shall be in place on areas representing at least 30 % of the additional overall surface needed to reach the total favourable reference area of each group of habitat types listed in Annex I, as quantified in the national restoration plan referred to in Article 12, by 2030, at least 60 % of that surface by 2040, and 100 % of that surface by 2050
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Ecosystem Conservation" as it aims to conserve and restore ecosystems.

column2: Transport by inland waterways and short sea shipping will increase by 25% compared to 2015, by 2030. They will increase by 50% by 2050.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transportation" because it aims to increase the use of sustainable transportation modes.

column2: Transport by inland waterways and short sea shipping will increase by 25% compared to 2015, by 2030. They will increase by 50% by 2050.
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Modal Shift" as it aims to shift transportation modes towards more sustainable options.

column2: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides (target in common with the Biodiversity Strategy and Zero Pollution Action Plan)
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Agriculture" because it aims to reduce the use of hazardous pesticides in agriculture.

column2: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides (target in common with the Biodiversity Strategy and Zero Pollution Action Plan)
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Reducing Chemical Use" as it aims to decrease the use of hazardous pesticides.

column2: The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall not exceed these limits: 2 % from 1 January 2025, 6 % from 1 January 2030, 14,5 % from 1 January 2035, 31 % from 1 January 2040, 62 % from 1 January 2045, 80 % from 1 January 2050.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Decarbonizing Transportation" because it aims to reduce the GHG intensity of energy used in shipping.

column2: The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall not exceed these limits: 2 % from 1 January 2025, 6 % from 1 January 2030, 14,5 % from 1 January 2035, 31 % from 1 January 2040, 62 % from 1 January 2045, 80 % from 1 January 2050.
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Greenhouse Gas Reduction" as it aims to decrease GHG emissions from shipping.

column2: Promoting the sustainable forest bioeconomy for long-lived wood products
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Forest Management" because it aims to promote sustainable forest bioeconomy.

column2: Promoting the sustainable forest bioeconomy for long-lived wood products
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Forest Conservation" as it aims to conserve forests through sustainable management.

column2: 2040 target under discussion
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Climate Goal Setting" because it mentions a target for 2040, implying a goal-setting process.

column2: 2040 target under discussion
column5: The content of this target is too vague to assign it to a specific sub-theme, hence it is also assigned to "Unclassified".

column2: (pollinator) Member States shall, by putting in place appropriate and effective measures, improve pollinator diversity and reverse the decline of pollinator populations at the latest by 2030 and achieve thereafter an increasing trend of pollinator populations, following the entry into force of the Regulation and measured every six years after 2030, until satisfactory levels are achieved, as set out in accordance with Article 11(3).
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Pollinator Conservation" because it focuses on improving pollinator diversity and reversing population decline.

column2: (pollinator) Member States shall, by putting in place appropriate and effective measures, improve pollinator diversity and reverse the decline of pollinator populations at the latest by 2030 and achieve thereafter an increasing trend of pollinator populations, following the entry into force of the Regulation and measured every six years after 2030, until satisfactory levels are achieved, as set out in accordance with Article 11(3).
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Biodiversity Protection" as it aims to protect pollinator populations, which are part of biodiversity.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall ensure that all waste portable batteries, Light Means of Transport (LMT) and SLI batteries, regardless of their nature, chemical composition, condition, brand or origin, are collected separately in the territory of a Member State where they make these batteries available on the market for the first time.
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Waste Management" because it deals with the collection of waste batteries.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall ensure that all waste portable batteries, Light Means of Transport (LMT) and SLI batteries, regardless of their nature, chemical composition, condition, brand or origin, are collected separately in the territory of a Member State where they make these batteries available on the market for the first time.
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Circular Economy" as it promotes the separate collection of waste, which is a principle of circular economy.

column2: Scheduled collective travel of under 500 km should be carbon neutral within the EU
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Decarbonizing Transportation" because it aims to make collective travel carbon neutral.

column2: Scheduled collective travel of under 500 km should be carbon neutral within the EU
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Low-Carbon Mobility" as it focuses on reducing carbon emissions from transportation.

column2: The total quantity of allowances for the new emissions trading system should follow a linear trajectory to reach the emission reduction target for 2030, taking into account the cost-efficient contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005 and of the additional sectors, a combined cost-efficient contribution of 42 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Emissions Reduction" because it aims to reduce emissions through an emissions trading system.

column2: The total quantity of allowances for the new emissions trading system should follow a linear trajectory to reach the emission reduction target for 2030, taking into account the cost-efficient contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005 and of the additional sectors, a combined cost-efficient contribution of 42 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005.
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Carbon Pricing" as it involves an emissions trading system, which is a form of carbon pricing.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, is able to produce at least 15% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Raw Material Security" because it aims to ensure a secure supply of critical raw materials.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, is able to produce at least 15% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Recycling and Reuse" as it promotes recycling to secure raw materials.

column2: By 2022 achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between that Member State's binding 2020 national target, and its contribution to the 2030 target of share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption of energy. Achieve 43% by 2025, 65% by 2027
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy Development" because it sets milestones for increasing the share of renewable energy.

column2: By 2022 achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between that Member State's binding 2020 national target, and its contribution to the 2030 target of share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption of energy. Achieve 43% by 2025, 65% by 2027
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Transition" as it aims to transition towards more renewable energy sources.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries: 45 % by 31 December 2023, 63 % by 31 December 2027, 73 % by 31 December 2030.
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Waste Collection" because it sets targets for collecting waste portable batteries.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries: 45 % by 31 December 2023, 63 % by 31 December 2027, 73 % by 31 December 2030.
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Circular Economy" as it promotes the collection and recycling of waste, which is a principle of circular economy.

column2: Recycled content in industrial batteries, electric vehicle batteries, LMT batteries and SLI batteries: Cobalt:  16 % by 2031 (26% by 2036), Lead: 85% (85%), Nickel: 6% (12%), Lithium 6% (15%)
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Recycling and Reuse" because it sets targets for the recycled content in various types of batteries.

column2: Recycled content in industrial batteries, electric vehicle batteries, LMT batteries and SLI batteries: Cobalt:  16 % by 2031 (26% by 2036), Lead: 85% (85%), Nickel: 6% (12%), Lithium 6% (15%)
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Material Use" as it aims to increase the use of recycled materials in battery production.

column2: To achieve 55% reduction of GHG emission by 2030, methane emissions related to energy production and consumption should be reduced by 58% compared to the level in 2020
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Methane Emissions Reduction" because it specifically aims to reduce methane emissions.

column2: To achieve 55% reduction of GHG emission by 2030, methane emissions related to energy production and consumption should be reduced by 58% compared to the level in 2020
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Greenhouse Gas Reduction" as reducing methane emissions contributes to overall GHG reduction.

column2: Improve nutrient removal from wastewater. Tertiary treatment should be systematically imposed to all urban wastewater treatment plants of 100 000 p.e. and above, as such plants represent an important remaining source of nitrogen and phosphorus discharge. Tertiary treatment should also be mandatory in agglomerations of 10 000 p.e. and above that are discharging in areas subject to, or at risk of, eutrophication.
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Water Pollution Control" because it aims to improve nutrient removal from wastewater to prevent pollution.

column2: Improve nutrient removal from wastewater. Tertiary treatment should be systematically imposed to all urban wastewater treatment plants of 100 000 p.e. and above, as such plants represent an important remaining source of nitrogen and phosphorus discharge. Tertiary treatment should also be mandatory in agglomerations of 10 000 p.e. and above that are discharging in areas subject to, or at risk of, eutrophication.
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Wastewater Management" as it deals with the treatment of wastewater.

column2: Renovate the EU’s maritime fleet (e.g. passenger ships and supply vessels for offshore installations) to improve their energy efficiency
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Maritime Transport Efficiency" because it aims to improve the energy efficiency of the maritime fleet.

column2: Renovate the EU’s maritime fleet (e.g. passenger ships and supply vessels for offshore installations) to improve their energy efficiency
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transportation" as it aims to make maritime transport more sustainable.

column2: Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Plastic Waste Reduction" because it sets targets for the separate collection and recycling of plastic bottles.

column2: Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Circular Economy" as it promotes the recycling of plastic waste, which is a principle of circular economy.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Raw Material Security" because it aims to ensure a secure supply of critical raw materials through processing capacity.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Resource Management" as it aims to manage resources sustainably to meet consumption needs.

column2: Promoting non-wood forest-based bioeconomy, including ecotourism
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Forest Management" because it promotes the bioeconomy based on forests, excluding wood.

column2: Promoting non-wood forest-based bioeconomy, including ecotourism
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Forest Conservation" as it aims to conserve forests through sustainable bioeconomy practices.

column2: Ensuring forest restoration and reinforced sustainable forest management for climate adaptation and forest resilience
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Forest Restoration" because it aims to restore forests for climate adaptation and resilience.

column2: Ensuring forest restoration and reinforced sustainable forest management for climate adaptation and forest resilience
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Forest Management" as it promotes sustainable management of forests for climate adaptation.

column2: (agricultural ecosystems) Member States shall put in place measures which shall aim to restore organic soils in agricultural use constituting drained peatlands. Those measures shall be in place on at least: (a) 30 % of such areas by 2030, of which at least a quarter shall be rewetted, (b) 40 % of such areas by 2040, of which at least a third shall be rewetted, (c) 50 % of such areas by 2050, of which at least a third shall be rewetted.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Soil Conservation" because it aims to restore organic soils in agricultural ecosystems.

column2: (agricultural ecosystems) Member States shall put in place measures which shall aim to restore organic soils in agricultural use constituting drained peatlands. Those measures shall be in place on at least: (a) 30 % of such areas by 2030, of which at least a quarter shall be rewetted, (b) 40 % of such areas by 2040, of which at least a third shall be rewetted, (c) 50 % of such areas by 2050, of which at least a third shall be rewetted.
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Ecosystem Restoration" as it aims to restore ecosystems through soil restoration.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027 -90% for cobalt, copper, lead and nickel, No later than 31 December 2031: -95% for cobalt, copper, lead, and nickel
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Recycling and Reuse" because it sets targets for the recovery of materials through recycling.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027 -90% for cobalt, copper, lead and nickel, No later than 31 December 2031: -95% for cobalt, copper, lead, and nickel
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Circular Economy" as it promotes high levels of material recovery through recycling, which is a principle of circular economy.

column2: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonized on the basis of renewable hydrogen
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Decarbonization of Industry" because it aims to decarbonize steel production using renewable hydrogen.

column2: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonized on the basis of renewable hydrogen
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Hydrogen Economy" as it involves the use of renewable hydrogen for decarbonization.

column2: Pursue the objective of zero-emission ports
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Port Emissions Reduction" because it aims to achieve zero emissions in ports.

column2: Pursue the objective of zero-emission ports
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transportation" as it aims to make port operations sustainable.

column2: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Antimicrobial Use Reduction" because it aims to reduce the use of antimicrobials in farming and aquaculture.

column2: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Agriculture" as reducing antimicrobial use is a part of sustainable agricultural practices.

column2: Preserve the affordability of food.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food Security" because it aims to preserve the affordability of food, which is a component of food security.

column2: Preserve the affordability of food.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Food Systems" as preserving affordability is part of ensuring sustainable food systems.

column2: Zero-emission in urban logistics
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Urban Mobility" because it aims to achieve zero emissions in urban logistics.

column2: Zero-emission in urban logistics
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transportation" as it aims to make urban logistics sustainable.

column2: (marine ecosystem) Member States shall ensure, by 2030 at the latest, that the condition is known for at least 50% of the area distributed over all habitat types listed in groups 1–6 of Annex II. The condition of all areas of groups 1–6 of habitat types listed in Annex II shall be known by 2040. Member States shall also ensure, by 2040 at the latest, that the condition is known for at least 50% of the area distributed over all habitat types listed in group 7 of Annex II. The condition of all areas of group 7 of habitat types listed in Annex II shall be known by 2050.
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Marine Conservation" because it focuses on knowing the condition of marine ecosystems.

column2: (marine ecosystem) Member States shall ensure, by 2030 at the latest, that the condition is known for at least 50% of the area distributed over all habitat types listed in groups 1–6 of Annex II. The condition of all areas of groups 1–6 of habitat types listed in Annex II shall be known by 2040. Member States shall also ensure, by 2040 at the latest, that the condition is known for at least 50% of the area distributed over all habitat types listed in group 7 of Annex II. The condition of all areas of group 7 of habitat types listed in Annex II shall be known by 2050.
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Ecosystem Monitoring" as it aims to monitor the condition of marine ecosystems.

column2: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90%
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Greenhouse Gas Reduction" because it aims to significantly cut emissions from the transport sector.

column2: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90%
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Decarbonizing Transportation" as cutting emissions by 90% implies a significant decarbonization effort.

column2: For new urban buses the share of zeroemissions vehicles shall be 100% as from the reporting period of the year 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Electrification of Transport" because it mandates the use of zero-emission vehicles for new urban buses.

column2: For new urban buses the share of zeroemissions vehicles shall be 100% as from the reporting period of the year 2030
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Urban Mobility" as it aims to make urban bus transport sustainable.

column2: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (a) the amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a: (i) share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030, or i) greenhouse gas intensity reduction of at least 14,5 % by 2030, compared to the baseline set out in Article 27(1), point (b), in accordance with an indicative trajectory set by the Member State
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy in Transport" because it sets a target for the share of renewable energy in the transport sector.

column2: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (a) the amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a: (i) share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030, or i) greenhouse gas intensity reduction of at least 14,5 % by 2030, compared to the baseline set out in Article 27(1), point (b), in accordance with an indicative trajectory set by the Member State
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transportation" as it aims to increase the use of renewable energy in transport, making it more sustainable.

column2: Tackle climate change: climate change adaptation and mitigation. Ensure that agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030 and to the achievement of the objective for a climate neutral Union in 2050.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Climate Change Mitigation" because it aims to reduce GHG emissions from agriculture and related sectors.

column2: Tackle climate change: climate change adaptation and mitigation. Ensure that agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030 and to the achievement of the objective for a climate neutral Union in 2050.
column3: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Agriculture" as it aims to make agriculture and related sectors contribute to climate neutrality.

column2: Member States shall determine an indicative national share of renewable energy produced on-site or nearby as well as renewable energy taken from the grid in final energy consumption in their building sector in 2030 that is consistent with an indicative target of at least a 49 % share of energy from renewable sources in the building sector in the Union’s final energy consumption in buildings in 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Renewable Energy in Buildings" because it sets a target for the share of renewable energy in the building sector.

column2: Member States shall determine an indicative national share of renewable energy produced on-site or nearby as well as renewable energy taken from the grid in final energy consumption in their building sector in 2030 that is consistent with an indicative target of at least a 49 % share of energy from renewable sources in the building sector in the Union’s final energy consumption in buildings in 2030
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Energy Efficiency in Buildings" as increasing the share of renewable energy in buildings contributes to energy efficiency.

column2: Starting from 2025, at least 2% of aviation fuels will be green, with this share increasing every five years: 6% in 2030, 20% in 2035, 34% in 2040, 42% in 2045 and 70% in 2050. Hydrogen and fuel produced from cooking oil or waste gases considered green (link agreement Council - Parliament on 25.04.2023)
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Aviation" because it sets targets for increasing the share of green fuels in aviation.

column2: Starting from 2025, at least 2% of aviation fuels will be green, with this share increasing every five years: 6% in 2030, 20% in 2035, 34% in 2040, 42% in 2045 and 70% in 2050. Hydrogen and fuel produced from cooking oil or waste gases considered green (link agreement Council - Parliament on 25.04.2023)
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Alternative Fuels" as it promotes the use of green fuels in aviation.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%) and microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Water Pollution Control" because it aims to improve water quality by reducing waste and microplastics.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%) and microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Marine Pollution Reduction" as it focuses on reducing pollution in marine environments.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30 % in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Food Waste Reduction" because it aims to reduce food waste generation.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30 % in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Consumption" as reducing food waste is part of sustainable consumption practices.

column2: (urban ecosystems) Member States shall ensure that there is no net loss in the total national area of urban green space, and of urban tree canopy cover in urban ecosystem areas. Member States may exclude from that total national area the urban ecosystem areas in which the share of urban green space in the urban centres and urban clusters exceeds 45 % and the share of urban tree canopy cover therein exceeds 10 %
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Urban Green Space Conservation" because it aims to prevent net loss in urban green spaces and tree canopy cover.

column2: (urban ecosystems) Member States shall ensure that there is no net loss in the total national area of urban green space, and of urban tree canopy cover in urban ecosystem areas. Member States may exclude from that total national area the urban ecosystem areas in which the share of urban green space in the urban centres and urban clusters exceeds 45 % and the share of urban tree canopy cover therein exceeds 10 %
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Ecosystem Conservation" as it aims to conserve urban ecosystems.

column2: Nearly all cars, vans, buses as well as new heavy-duty vehicles will be zero-emission
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Electrification of Transport" because it aims to make nearly all new vehicles zero-emission.

column2: Nearly all cars, vans, buses as well as new heavy-duty vehicles will be zero-emission
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Decarbonizing Transportation" as making vehicles zero-emission is a key step in decarbonizing transportation.

column2: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (B) the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of nonbiological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1 % in 2025 and 3,5 % in 2030, of which a share of at least 1 percentage point is from renewable fuels of non-biological origin in 2030
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Alternative Fuels" because it sets targets for the share of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels of non-biological origin in transport.

column2: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (B) the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of nonbiological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1 % in 2025 and 3,5 % in 2030, of which a share of at least 1 percentage point is from renewable fuels of non-biological origin in 2030
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transportation" as it aims to increase the use of sustainable fuels in transport.

column2: Combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world (SDG 15.3)
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Land Degradation Neutrality" because it aims to combat desertification and achieve a land degradation-neutral world.

column2: Combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world (SDG 15.3)
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Soil Conservation" as it aims to restore degraded land and soil.

column2: Recycling of wood in packaging: 30%
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Wood Waste Recycling" because it sets a target for recycling wood in packaging.

column2: Recycling of wood in packaging: 30%
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Circular Economy" as it promotes recycling, which is a principle of circular economy.

column2: Euro 7 pollutant limits
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Air Pollution Reduction" because it aims to reduce pollutant emissions from vehicles.

column2: Euro 7 pollutant limits
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Vehicle Emissions Standards" as it involves setting limits on pollutant emissions from vehicles.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall ensure that there is: (a) an increase of habitat area in good condition for habitat types listed in Annex I until at least 90 % is in good condition and until the favourable reference area for each habitat type in each biogeographic region of the Member State concerned is reached, (b) an increasing trend towards the sufficient quality and quantity of the terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of the species referred to in Annexes II, IV and V to Directive 92/43/EEC and of the species covered by Directive 2009/147/EC
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Habitat Restoration" because it aims to increase the area of habitats in good condition.

column2: (terrestrial, coastal and freshwater ecosystems) Member States shall ensure that there is: (a) an increase of habitat area in good condition for habitat types listed in Annex I until at least 90 % is in good condition and until the favourable reference area for each habitat type in each biogeographic region of the Member State concerned is reached, (b) an increasing trend towards the sufficient quality and quantity of the terrestrial, coastal and freshwater habitats of the species referred to in Annexes II, IV and V to Directive 92/43/EEC and of the species covered by Directive 2009/147/EC
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Ecosystem Conservation" as it aims to conserve and improve the quality and quantity of habitats.

column2: The death toll for all modes of transport in the EU will be close to zero
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Transport Safety" because it aims to reduce the death toll from transport accidents to nearly zero.

column2: The death toll for all modes of transport in the EU will be close to zero
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transportation" as making transport safe is part of making it sustainable.

column2: Making all packaging recyclable (see European Parliament resolution of 10 February 2021 on the New Circular Economy Action Plan, the New Circular Economy Action Plan and art. 5 of this Proposal)
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Packaging Waste Reduction" because it aims to make all packaging recyclable.

column2: Making all packaging recyclable (see European Parliament resolution of 10 February 2021 on the New Circular Economy Action Plan, the New Circular Economy Action Plan and art. 5 of this Proposal)
column3: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Circular Economy" as making packaging recyclable is a key aspect of circular economy.

column2: Increase the uptake of short-sea shipping instead of using more polluting modes
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Sustainable Transportation" because it aims to increase the use of short-sea shipping as a more sustainable option.

column2: Increase the uptake of short-sea shipping instead of using more polluting modes
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Modal Shift" as it involves shifting from more polluting modes to short-sea shipping.

column2: Develop measures to significantly increase efforts to identify, investigate, assess and remediate contaminated sites, so that soil pollution will no longer pose a health or environmental risk (target in common with the Biodiversity Strategy)
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is assigned to the sub-theme "Soil Remediation" because it aims to remediate contaminated sites to reduce soil pollution.

column2: Develop measures to significantly increase efforts to identify, investigate, assess and remediate contaminated sites, so that soil pollution will no longer pose a health or environmental risk (target in common with the Biodiversity Strategy)
column3: TA7_Towards a zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment
column5: This target is also assigned to the sub-theme "Pollution Prevention" as it aims to prevent health and environmental risks from soil pollution.
